Richards's attraction to Cota influences his actions in several ways. He also seems to be more protective of Cota, as evidenced by his warning to the editor not to mention her in the newspaper story. Additionally, Richards's behavior suggests that he is smitten with Cota, and his actions are motivated by a desire to impress her and win her favor.

Richards shares a similar experience with Colonel Starbottle in that he was also attacked near the fonda, and the assailant was a mysterious figure who was later revealed to be a pinto horse. Richards describes the incident in detail, stating that he was grabbed from behind and half-choked by someone, and that he managed to fire two shots under his arm before the assailant loosened its grip and slumped down on top of him. The pinto horse was found with two bullet holes in its neck, still gripping Richards's coat collar and neck-handkerchief in its teeth.
